intro: Dehaasia arunachalensis, commonly known as the Arunachal Pradesh dehaasia, is a rare flowering plant endemic to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in the understorey of tropical forests. It is notable for its limited distribution and is considered a species of conservation concern due to habitat loss. Its botanical study contributes to the understanding of regional biodiversity and ecological dynamics.
